intro: Tithymalus dilatatus, commonly known as the broad-leaved tithymalus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and features basal leaves that are broad and lance-shaped. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a food source for certain Lepidoptera species and its use in traditional herbal medicine.
